keyMoments.title: Pekkori Summons Satan (Brook)
keyMoments.description: Pekkori, the mayor of Namakura Island, leads a ritual to summon Satan to help fight the Longarm Tribe. Brook coincidentally lands in the summoning circle, and Pekkori believes he successfully summoned the Devil.
keyMoments.significance: First introduction of Pekkori and establishment of the conflict on Namakura Island.
keyMoments.quote: We summoned you to help us fight against the Longarm Tribe!

relationships.description: Pekkori believes Brook is Satan and asks for his help against the Longarm Tribe.

evolutionMoments.description: Pekkori summons Brook (thinking he's Satan) to help his village.

reveals.information: Mayor of Harahettania village on Namakura Island, known as the Land of Poverty
His village is being terrorized by the Longarm Tribe

keyMoments.title: Stalker Becomes Suspicious of Hancock
keyMoments.description: Lieutenant Junior Grade Stalker overhears Luffy burping loudly in Hancock's room and becomes suspicious, questioning if someone is with her.
keyMoments.significance: Nearly exposes Luffy's presence on the ship, prompting Hancock to use her powers to cover for him.

keyMoments.title: Comil Arrives at Marineford
keyMoments.description: Vice Admiral Comil, commander of Marine Base G-2, arrives at Marineford alongside other high-ranking Marines in preparation for the war with Whitebeard.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the gathering of the World Government's forces for the impending Marineford War.

reveals.information: Commander of Marine Base G-2 with the rank of Vice Admiral

keyMoments.title: Zoro Wakes on Kuraigana Island
keyMoments.description: Zoro awakens on the dark and gloomy Kuraigana Island after being sent there by Bartholomew Kuma, discovering ruins and encountering hostile Humandrills.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up Zoro's future training with Mihawk during the two-year timeskip.

keyMoments.title: Perona Humiliates Zoro
keyMoments.description: After treating his wounds, Perona uses her Negative Hollows to knock Zoro out and dresses him in a Kumashi bear costume, attempting to make him her servant.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the comedic dynamic between Zoro and Perona during their time on the island.

relationships.description: Perona treats Zoro's wounds but then humiliates him and tries to make him her servant. Despite their antagonistic start, they develop an unlikely companionship.

evolutionMoments.description: Perona treats Zoro's wounds, then humiliates him by dressing him in a Kumashi costume.

keyMoments.title: Brook Arrives on Namakura Island
keyMoments.description: Brook lands on Namakura Island after being sent there by Bartholomew Kuma, coincidentally appearing inside a demonic summoning circle during a ritual.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up Brook's storyline helping the impoverished villagers against the Longarm Tribe.

keyMoments.title: Mistaken for Satan
keyMoments.description: The villagers of Namakura Island believe they successfully summoned Satan when Brook appears in their summoning circle, and ask for his help against the Longarm Tribe.
keyMoments.significance: A comedic moment that establishes Brook's role helping the desperate villagers.

relationships.description: Brook agrees to help Pekkori and the villagers fight against the Longarm Tribe after being mistaken for Satan.

evolutionMoments.description: Brook is mistaken for Satan by Pekkori and the villagers, who ask for his help.

name.japanese: ポートガス・D・エース

keyMoments.title: Ace Begs Garp to Kill Him
keyMoments.description: In his cell at Impel Down, Ace has an emotional confrontation with Garp, begging his grandfather to kill him to prevent the coming war, but Garp refuses.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Ace's despair and the painful conflict between Garp's duty and family bonds.
keyMoments.quote: Gramps... just kill me. End this before it goes any further.

relationships.description: Ace's relationship with his grandfather Garp is shown in painful detail as he begs Garp to kill him to prevent the war.

evolutionMoments.description: Ace begs Garp to kill him to prevent the war, showing his desperation and love for his family.

reveals.information: Ace is in despair and willing to die to prevent the war between the Marines and Whitebeard

keyMoments.title: Garp Refuses to Kill Ace
keyMoments.description: Garp visits Ace in Impel Down and refuses his grandson's plea to kill him, stating that even if he did, the war with Whitebeard cannot be avoided.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Garp's internal conflict between his duty as a Marine and his love for his family.
keyMoments.quote: Even if I did, the war with Whitebeard cannot be avoided.

relationships.description: Garp's painful position as Ace's grandfather but also a loyal Marine is highlighted as he refuses to kill Ace despite understanding his grandson's desperation.

evolutionMoments.description: Garp painfully refuses Ace's request to kill him, acknowledging the inevitability of war.

reveals.information: Garp is torn between his duty to the Marines and his love for his grandson Ace

keyMoments.title: Hancock's Jealousy Over Luffy
keyMoments.description: Hancock worries that Luffy will leave her for Nami and Robin while helping him hide on Momonga's ship.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Hancock's growing affection and insecurity about her relationship with Luffy.

keyMoments.title: Hancock Covers for Luffy
keyMoments.description: When Stalker overhears Luffy, Hancock uses her powers to turn the Marines' hair into mohawks and imitates Luffy's words to protect him.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Hancock's quick thinking and devotion to helping Luffy reach Impel Down.

relationships.description: Hancock's romantic feelings for Luffy deepen as she helps him reach Impel Down while worrying about losing him to other women.

evolutionMoments.description: Hancock worries about Luffy leaving her for Nami and Robin, showing her insecurity and deepening feelings.

keyMoments.title: Perona on Kuraigana Island
keyMoments.description: Perona is revealed to be on Kuraigana Island after being sent there by Kuma. She discovers the injured Zoro and decides to treat his wounds.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the unlikely pairing of Perona and Zoro on the island during the timeskip.

keyMoments.title: Perona's Mischief with Zoro
keyMoments.description: Perona uses her Negative Hollows to knock out Zoro and dresses him in a Kumashi costume, attempting to make him her servant.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Perona's playful and mischievous personality.
keyMoments.quote: You're going to be my new servant!

relationships.description: Perona treats Zoro's wounds but then uses her powers to humiliate him, establishing a complicated dynamic between them.

evolutionMoments.description: Perona discovers injured Zoro, treats his wounds, then humiliates him for her amusement.

reveals.information: Perona was also sent to Kuraigana Island by Bartholomew Kuma
